channel.title: Resumes on Hannah Danks
channel.description: Recent content in Resumes on Hannah Danks

item.title: About Me
item.description: About Me Canadian born, I was raised North of Dallas in Frisco, Texas. Having found a passion for taking care of animals early on, I have been driven throughout my education by the motivation to attend veterinary school and become a wildlife rescue veterinarian. I am currently in the application and interview process and am very excited for what’s in store! Interests In my free time, I enjoying all things nature.

item.title: Accomplishments
item.description: Accomplishments I have received University Honors from the University of Texas each semester since Spring 2017. I have also received two scholarships: the Carol Shay Honorary Scholarship and the Beta Eta Membership Scholarship.

item.title: Education
item.description: Education I have attended the University of Texas at Austin, where I will obtain a Bachelors in Science and Art in the Fall of 2019. My degree was focused in Biology with a study equivalent to a minor in Psychology. I have also received a Pre-Health Professions Certificate during this time. Skills I have a base level knowledge of R Studio and Python. I have also acquired basic veterinary teching skills including: restraints, blood draws, nail trims, and other hygiene techniques.

item.title: Work Experience
item.description: Work Experience I have worked as a kennel technician for over 350 hours at the Legacy Veterinary Hospital in Frisco, Texas, practicing skills such as medicating, hygiene techniques, and nail trims. I have worked as a technicians’ assistant since April of 2019 for Crestview Veterinary Clinic in Austin, Texas where I have gained experiences such as blood draws and other teching duties. I was also a teaching assistant in the Fall of 2019 for a Neuroscience class, From the Eye to the Brain.
